title: What is Homeopathy?
cleaned_text: What is Homeopathy? Homeopathy uses natural remedies in dilute quantities to stimulate the body's own healing ability. Its' philosophy dates back over two thousand years to the so-called Father of Medicine, Hippocrates, and was rediscovered in 1796 by a German doctor, Samuel Hahnemann. Homeopathy has been safely used for over 200 years and can offer lasting relief from symptoms. The prescription is matched to your personal symptoms, and works with your own immune system to restore health and wellbeing. When used by a qualified practitioner homeopathic treatment is gentle, safe, non-toxic and free from side effects. Homeopathic remedies can be safely given to babies, children, pregnant women and the elderly. How Can Homeopathy Help? Homeopathy has been shown to be effective in a wide range of acute and chronic conditions, and can address both physical and emotional complaints. Offering much of what conventional medicine has to offer(anti-inflammatories, anti-bacterials, anti-virals, analgesics), homeopathy can be used for the whole family, and has been successfully prescribed for a variety of health problems, from asthma, eczema, allergies and hay fever to flu, fever, anxiety, depression, migraine, arthritis, ibs, menopause symptoms and fertility problems, to name but a few. For more information on how homeopathy can help you, go to the "Help With" area of the website.
